item.title: Report X-2024120746
item.description:
Report X-2024120746

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-16T12:32:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-10
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A PACKAGE CAME TO QA BECAUSE IT WAS LEAKING OUT OF THE BOTTOM. UPON INSPECTION THIS WAS DETERMINED TO BE 3 ONE GALLON BOTTLES OF CLOROX GERMICIDAL BLEACH CONCENTRATE. THIS WAS DETERMINED TO BE HAZARDOUS ACCORDING TO THE SDS. THERE IS TWO LOOSE CAPS AND THE OTHER BOTTLE IS COVERED IN THE BLEACH. THESE ARE ALL CONSIDERED DAMAGED AND WILL BE HELD FOR DISPOSITION LOCALLY.

item.title: Report E-2024120253
item.description:
Report E-2024120253

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-16T12:32:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-15
  • City: CORBIN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7580
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, the connection between the delivery hose and tank adaptor became compromised. This allowed approximately 20 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. PECCO Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
